meanings.definition: Make or become less sensitive or responsive.
meanings.sent1: Loud music can deaden our hearing over time.
meanings.sent2: The painkiller will deaden the sensation in your arm.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture seemed to deaden everyone's interest in the topic.
meanings.sent4: The gray clouds seemed to deaden the vibrant colors of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The cold winter air seemed to deaden all sound, creating a peaceful silence.

meanings.definition: To make or become less lively, intense, or active.
meanings.sent1: The rain started to deaden the flames of the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The medication may deaden your energy levels temporarily.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's bad jokes seemed to deaden the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: The long work hours can deaden one's enthusiasm for hobbies.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous routine seemed to deaden the excitement of the new job.
